text: Hi everyone, I’m Luc from Markentive
I was wondering if it would be possible to add a Author Template in the blog templates ?

You can actually already do that, I don’t unfortunately have it handy right this second but in the default blog template there’s HubL for detecting if the page is an author page or not. If you are using a coded template you could wrap everything in that.

If you’re using a drag n drop template for your blog, have all the layout stuff that’s different for that page inside the blog module inside those tags.

only difference it’s just not it’s own template file.
Hi, thank you for the answer. Maybe I’m not clear, but I was thinking it would be clear to have a “Author Template” button at this part of the blog template. (I’m sending a screenshot)
<@UAV0S9P1C> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/UAV0S9P1C/FB05FCL6R/capture_d___e__cran_2018-06-01_a___14.59.14.png|Capture d’écran 2018-06-01 à 14.59.14.png>
+ We can’t preview Blog author page when designing it ?

Unfortunately no you can’t preview it  I don’t think - that would be a nice addition.[fortunately I haven’t seen any stats for people ever actually looking at those pages, so editing it and previewing it live, while it’s not ideal, is likely to not get noticed.]

And while I get the desire to have the button, really all the edit post template button and edit listing template button are doing is basically giving you a hubl field inside of an if statement, checking the is_listing_page variable.

Technically the listing template and post template are the same template. The buttons are just a convenience feature.
Okay thank you :slightly_smiling_face:
Being able to preview author pages, topic pages, and pages after the first page would be great.
I'm imagining being able to preview within a LP or Website page all of the dynamic HubDB slugs available underneath it...
<@U3A4KEWK1> Something like this would be neat, for HubDB pages but also for author etc
With dynamic pages you can at least kinda work around it just by using different row IDs when you're testing
But having that in the page builder UI is a good thought
true, but for the marketing team who doesn't necessarily touch the table (in some cases) or for the casual editor who wants to see something before launching it would be nice
You can add `hubdb_row_id=` to your preview query param. I put up an issue to include this in the preview UI a few months ago when I added this functionality but the FE team hasn't gotten to it yet
Oh, nice! Is that in the design previewer, or on the page preview?
Bumped it in priority, but this is only for content previews under `<https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/content/>`

probably based on the table associated to the page
from the advanced settings area
